attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Prosecutions for excess speed aalone are alienating motorists from the government. Motorways are designed for high speeds, to standards that predate the 70mph limit.
Compliance with 70, 60, 50, 40, 30 & 20 mph limits increases congestion, pollution, frustration and ill-mannered driving. 
Victim-less crimes of simply exceeding speed limits should not be prosecuted.
Prosecutions must consider the vehicle’s capability, condition and age, driver competence.
Residential areas to have advisory 20 & 30 mph limits.
Minor roads to have advisory 40 & 50 mph limits.
Dual carriageways to have advisory 70mph limits. 
Motorways to have advisory 100 mph limits. 
Penalties for speed contributing to an accident or injury should relate to the type of road and the accident conditions.
Skilled, responsible drivers in high speed vehicles should not be prosecuted for speed alone.
Any driver whose speed results in injury, death, damage or loss should expect severe sentencing, loss of license, and the need to retake a driving test.
